data.title: Transfer - Players worth keeping an eye on playing for other clubs
data.meta_site_name: The Fighting Cock - Tottenham Hotspur (Spurs) Forum
data.text:
Caught a glimpse of a left-footed centre half called Jorrel Hato (16) playing for Holland, he's at Ajax currently. Think he captains both sides.

Something special about him IMO, would expect Ajax to hand him a full debut this season at some point.

Harder to tell at this age, but looks one for the future.

Ben Doak that Liverpool signed from Celtic is an absolute cracker. Massive future.

Scotland will have a good side in the next 10 years or so.

We will still find a way to screw it up.

LCB Micky Van de Ven with an assist as Wolfsburg continue their incredible form after the winter break.

Niko Kovac's squad are smashing 2nd/3rd place Freiburg 4-0 in the 60th minute.

Van de Ven just drew a penalty (which was converted) to make it 6-0 Wolfsburg over Freiburg.

Kovac switched Van de Ven over to LB when Lacroix subbed on for LB Paulo Silva @ 71'.

IMO, Van de Ven is (presently) better than Bastoni and on par with Gvardiol, but he has a higher ceiling than both.

Love what Kovac is doing at Wolfsburg.

Jhon DurÃ¡n FIFA 22 Feb 3, 2022 SoFIFA

Jhon DurÃ¡n (Jhon JÃ¡der DurÃ¡n Palacio, born 13 December 2003) is a Colombian footballer who plays as a striker for American club Chicago Fire. In the game FIFA 22, his overall rating is 55.

I only just saw this post now but he just went to Villa and Iâ€™ll be excited to see how he does. I follow the Fire so watched his coming up last season and figured he needed another year before a team came calling. Physically heâ€™s well suited for the PL as heâ€™s big, fast, and powerful. Heâ€™s well composed with the ball at his feet, but heâ€™s not super creative either.

Caught a glimpse of a left-footed centre half called Jorrel Hato (16) playing for Holland, he's at Ajax currently. Think he captains both sides.

Something special about him IMO, would expect Ajax to hand him a full debut this season at some point.

Harder to tell at this age, but looks one for the future.

Has been brought on from the bench for his full Ajax debut in a Cup match and has been on the bench 3 times this month in the league.

Worth keeping an eye out for. Him and the massive PSG lad are probably the two best prospects as defenders I've seen in a long time.

Here's a new one to add to the mix. Top 5 prospects in each position that you know of at lesser clubs than ours. Good to keep an eye on how these boys work out:

RB

Aaron Wan-Bissaka (Crystal Palace)

Benjamin Henrichs (Monaco)

Noussa Mazraoui (Ajax)

Achraf Hakimi (Dortmund on loan from Real Madrid)

Pedro Porro (Girona)

CB

Boubacar Kamara (Marseille)

Malang Sarr (Nice)

Eder Militao (Porto)

Evan N'Dicka (Frankfurt)

Dayot Upamecano (RB Leipzig)

DM

Sander Berge (Genk)

Amadou Diawara (Napoli)

Sandro Tonali (Brescia)

Arne Maier (Hertha Berlin)

Lucas Tousart (Lyon)

CM

Frankie De Jong (Ajax)

Riqui Puig (Barcelona)

Yacine Adli (PSG)

Fran Beltran (Celta Vigo)

Florian Neuhaus (Monchengladbach)

AM

Kai Haivertz (Leverkusen)

Brahim Diaz (Real Madrid)

David Brooks (Bournemouth)

Nicolas Pepe (Lille)

Giorgi Chakvetadze (Gent)

FWD

Moise Kean (Juventus)

Moussa Sylla (Monaco)

Luka Jovic (Frankfurt)

Matheus Cunha (RB Leipzig)

Patrick Cutrone (AC Milan)

The ones I'd absolutely love to see us go for are Berge, Tonali, Puig & Chakvetadze from what I've seen. I'd also be keeping tabs on Dani Ceballos over in Madrid for the rest of the year as I think he has bags of potential.

Finally we get a player from my list through the door. Happy with this one
